black.content: What’s my special interest?_
To the great surprise of the Autistic community, the latest film from Autism Speaks portrays _ in a positive light.
In Temple Grandin’s upcoming book, she explains that cows are similar to autistic people because they both have _.
What’s the best way to come out as autistic?_
Some people flap when they’re happy. I flap because of _.
I tried to drive from _ to _, but due to my horrible navigational skills, I wound up in _ instead.
Where do spoons come from?_
_ doesn’t make you autistic! That happens to everyone!
This year’s Light It Up Blue campaign aims to put light bulbs all over _.
New reports claim that _ must have been autistic because they liked _.
Although vaccine theories have been thoroughly discredited, some studies suggest that autism is really caused by _.
You can’t be autistic if you’re capable of _.
The reason there are no autistic adults is because every autistic 17-year-old experiences _.
I meant to say _, but my text-to-speech app autocorrected it to _.
Following the consolidation of Autism Spectrum Disorder in the DSM, the ICD will now refer to the entire autism spectrum as _.
Labels belong on _, not people.
To avoid “ass burgers” jokes, Asperger syndrome will be renamed _.
In her latest Playboy video, Jenny McCarthy uses her son’s autism as inspiration for _.
You're only _ because you're autistic.
Don’t you hate seeing everyone on their phones all the time? I miss the old days when we had _.
A collaborative campaign between Autism Speaks and PETA will feature nude models with the slogan: “_“.

white: Stuffing one bag full of everything you could possibly need.
Texting someone who is right in front of you.
Eye contact.
Flapping your nail polish dry.
Infodumping about the menstrual cycle.
Self-diagnosis.
Knowing more about your neurotype than a psychologist with a PhD.
Forgetting to eat.
A bleach enema.
Cows.
The disgusting taste of bottled water.
Making suggestive eyebrow movements at the wall next to you.
Fad diets.
Friends doing unrelated things in close proximity.
Rain Man.
Going to a museum to touch all the sculptures.
Guessing people’s names.
Cats.
Exclusively dating autistic people to further the master race.
Running out of spoons while spooning.
Tasting spice in food labeled not spicy.
Exploiting the stereotype that autistic can’t lie to get out of trouble.
Going outside, then realizing there’s no wi-fi and going back inside.
The internet.
That one autistic character on that one episode of that one show.
Having pets who understand you better than humans do.
Measles parties.
Accidentally staring at a woman’s breasts while avoiding eye contact.
Proposing marriage with a plastic spinner ring.
Temple Grandin.
Just nodding and smiling because you’ve already said “can you repeat that?” three times.
Clothes with no tags.
Memorizing the script to a porn movie.
Bribing the diagnostician to make you sound more disabled on paper.
Searching for beer while lost in the desert.
Socio-emotional reciprocity.
Nikola Tesla making sweet love to his imaginary laser pigeon.
Knowing useless facts about everything.
Having situational mutism during wedding vows.
Subtly switching to the green communication card when an attractive person is nearby.
